comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article70592536 gap partly filled by 1876 nla.gov.au/nla.news-article70961251 filled by 1881 nla.gov.au/nla.news-article70457651 ; nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13200383 the Blackwall stores appear to have been significantly damaged by fire in Feb 1870 nla.gov.au/nla.news-article70602537 some info re the east Circular Quay wool stores in 1876

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] so far I've had no luck establishing what happened after the 1870 fire at the Blackwall Wool Stores...it appears that the damage was limited...the Blackwall Stores remained in operation for many years afterwards...but I've yet to find a newspaper item which mentions a rebuild or refurbishment after the 1870 fire...you'd think some damage might have been visible from the exterior for a few months at least...I'm also drawing blanks on construction details/dates for the two stores which filled the gap  beside the Talbot stores...maybe the Sydney Wool & Stock Journal (digitised but not yet available) will have a few helpful items on the east Circular Quay wool stores...
